questions.question: In metallic nanowires, electrical conductivity typically:

answers.a: Decreases at small sizes due to electron scattering

explanations.a: At very small sizes, electron scattering at surfaces and boundaries increases, leading to reduced electrical conductivity.
explanations.b: Electrical conductivity usually decreases, not increases.
explanations.c: Conductivity changes with size due to scattering effects.
explanations.d: Conductivity does not drop to zero solely because of size.

questions.question: Why do magnetic nanoparticles exhibit superparamagnetism at small sizes?

answers.a: The spins align perfectly at all sizes
answers.b: The material is always in a magnetic state
answers.c: Thermal fluctuations cause random alignment of spins

explanations.a: Spins do not align perfectly at all sizes, especially small ones.
explanations.b: Magnetic state can fluctuate at nanoscale.
explanations.c: Thermal energy is enough to randomly orient magnetic moments, causing superparamagnetism.
explanations.d: Electron scattering does not cause ferromagnetism in this context.

questions.question: Which of the following is the best indicator of a nanomaterial's enhanced chemical activity?

explanations.a: Density is not the key factor.
explanations.b: Atomic number remains the same for an element.
explanations.c: High surface area to volume ratio provides more reactive sites.
explanations.d: Lattice energy may influence properties but is less direct.

questions.question: In size vs property plots, non-linear variation is mostly observed due to:

explanations.a: Classical mechanics generally predicts linear or smooth changes.
explanations.b: Surface impurities affect properties but are not the main cause of non-linearity.
explanations.c: Quantum size effects cause distinct non-linear behavior at nanoscale.
explanations.d: Atomic spacing changes with size and affects properties.

questions.question: Which property becomes dominant in nanoparticles but is negligible in bulk materials?

explanations.a: Volume is dominant in bulk materials, not nanoparticles.
explanations.b: Surface properties dominate at the nanoscale due to increased surface area.
explanations.c: Atomic weight is constant and not size-dependent.
explanations.d: Gravitational interaction is negligible at this scale.
